item.title: Poisen ivy (sword) (first model)
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

well considering this is your first model its rather good although if you made the hilt another colour that matches green (solid colour) it would have made it seem better and try working on actully making it like the object you copy… like you called it “poisen ivy (sword)” i think if you made some kinda leaf like thing on the hilt it would of improved it and maybe afew little spikes here and there but other then that nice first try

Read full topic

item.title: Poisen ivy (sword) (first model)
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote="† Kane †, post:4, topic:378120"]Yeah it’s not required but people seem to respect it more.[/quote]Hardly. It isn’t respectable to post a wireframe, people will just request one so they can criticize the model better. In this case, it isn’t needed due to the simplicity.[quote=“migetman40, post:5, topic:378120”]thanks for the advice riped, im glad someone know’s the difference between constructive criticism and just criticizing without helping at all… [/quote]Not a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Poisen ivy (sword) (first model)
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote="† Kane †, post:2, topic:378120"]Post a wireframe, and all that other crap that’s required.[/quote]Wireframes aren’t required by any means. If the author wants to post it, he can. If not, then no. I can’t remember the last time I posted a wireframe for one of my models. Besides, you can see where the wireframe would be on this model.

Its an ok start. Try to elaborate it more, because it looks like it has no more than 50 faces. For your next model, make it more detailed, make people want to download it, make it pretty :3

Read full topic
